com:
Somewhere in the infinite Multiverse, there exists a version of the Marvel Universe where, instead of a Peter Parker who was bitten by a radioactive spider, there exists a Petra Parker who was stung by a radioactive honey bee, becoming the heroine: The Heroic Honey-Bee!

here's a rundown of the rules of this universe:
>Only Peter Parker and his costumed friends and enemies (be them hero or villain) are changed, except for Dr. Connors, because it's funny
>Non-costumed folks (i.e. JJJ, Aunt May and Uncle Ben, MJ, Gwen Stacy, Harry, etc.) are not swapped, though their characters may be affected
>The outside Marvel Universe (Avengers, F4, X-men, Daredevil and Hell's Kitchen group) are unchanged
>Swaps are more than just gender, but also in concept (i.e. Instead of a proficient illusionist, we have an incompetent witch. Instead of a villain themed to an aquatic creature with multiple limbs, we have a villain themed to a land animal with multiple legs, etc.)

Wiki: https://cor63au.fandom.com/wiki/The_Heroic_Honey-Bee

Previous: https://desuarchive.org/co/thread/134142214/

com:
There is zero mainstream awareness of these people or their properties, yet several of them regularly get a large amount of money for their campaigns. From what I can see they’re IP’a, such as Isom and Cyberfrog have zero organic fandom and basically just sell comics to their preexisting fandom.

There is no future in this mode. It doesn’t bring in new readers, the pricing is way to high to bring in casuals and the mainstream wants to keep about a million miles between themselves and these controversial figures. The cost of living is skyrocketing and these creators somehow believe that they can sell $35, 100 page graphic novels, to a few thousand fans, forever.

The entire business mode seems to be built on “we are an alternative to the some mainstream entertainment business”, but what happens when the mainstream gets back into the business of being opiates for the masses? How can they justify their exorbitant price and inconsistent release schedule at that point?

It all seems super shady to me. The Rippa guy that supposedly made 4.5 mil did so through his private website, so that’s all unconfirmable. The embrace from right wing media that EVS and Rippa have had have made me suspect that there are Right Wing groups pumping money into some of these campaigns.

The whole business seems retarded and unsustainable

>What is this thread?
Every Wins'day at Win-O'-Clock we gather here and post links to the latest scans and rips of comic books.
Most links we uploaded ourselves, others we are sharing from elsewhere.

If you'd like to help out, just ask and we would be delighted to tell you how.

http://desuarchive.org/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/

(Note: This finds the OP for old threads. If you want to search for comics in the archive, clear the subject field!)

>Where can I find downloads for other comics?
Warez forums/blogs, DDL-indexing search engines (like FilesLoop), torrent trackers (like 1337x) and other P2P networks (like DC++).
If a link has been posted on 4chan, you can search for it in the Desu archive (add "http*" to searches to return only posts with links).
If all else fails, just >buy it.

>Where can I buy comics?
http://www.amazon.com/
On the various publishers' webstores, and at your local comics shop.

>Where can I find an LCS?
http://www.comicshoplocator.com/

>Where can I find out when new comics are released?
http://www.comiclist.com/index.php
http://www.previewsworld.com

>How do I download from websites that only give me .exe files?
Untick the checkbox under the download button.

>How can I find this thread every week?
If you are using the inline extension go to http://4chan.org/co/official or use the option under "Filters & Post Hiding".
If you have 4chanX go to Settings > Filter > Subject and add the following line:
/Official Win-O'-Thread/;highlight

last_replies.com:
It's "daddy issues the movie" and I kinda liked it for that. It's a moralizing tale for dads more than for sons, so in a way it goes completely against the "you need to behave" morals of the original story. It is its own thing in many ways, not just by adding the wartme Italy aspect to it. The movie's more about how a couple father figures shape Pinocchio's motivations, and since Volpe and Podesta are terrible parents (even moreso to Spazzatura and Candlewick), and Gepetto's an alcoholic, traumatized wreck, he makes some terrible decisions wanting to please him. I think Pinocchio being sort of an incorruptible, pure soul really fits, he was just born, and you need people to guide you, it's all about how Gepetto should be there for him and love him for what he is. The story's kinda fallen apart by the time Volpe shows up at the nazi camp but I think the ending makes up for that. I knew it was gonna end with Pinocchio resurrected, but I didn't see it turning sour and depressing in like 1 minute. One gets the impression Pinochio didn't get to enjoy life with his dad and his animal friends for very long.

Kinda fucked up there wasn't a plot point about changing the monkey's name tho. I have read some italian comics and I thoughtI remembered "spazzatura" meaning something bad, and indeed, it means "garbage". Makes sense Volpe called him that, but the poor little lad went to the grave with a name like that inscribed in it.

>>134496466
AI image generation has become a competing space of technologies and business models.
Whilst stuff like DALL-E 2 uses a credit system, Stable Diffusion is open and free and allows people to run it on their own system; using models provided by other people.

This is one such image generated locally on my machine with a consumer GPU.

So, of course AI generated art is full of flaws. The output is only as good as the training, like try asking it to do a Pikachu and it will manage something more than half-way there, but ask it to do a Charizard and it will be a mangled resemblance at best.
It can only generate stuff it was trained on, the model is more like a lens into what it's been learned.

AI art in its current stage can't be presented as a vertical slice or a deliverable, it's main use right now is just to laugh or take amusement at what's been generated, just to inevitably dispose of it because it lacks merit.
It does have utility though, it would be a useful resource for collaging or moodboarding. See what it cranks out, and see what you can take from it as reference material or inspiration. Ethically though, don't actually use the output directly.

I'm not a characterfag to the point where I'm still buying floppies of bad runs, but I'm trying to get all the Omnis of a select few. >>134495861
Him not being human is a running part of GDT’s Pinocchio in addition to the implications of it. When you can think of it being different in that metric it’s easier to separate the Disney version and this.

Gepetto having a dead son and constantly comparing his second son to the first one is actually a new angle the story previously never dwells on (at least in versions where Gepetto has an established dead son). In that kind of narrative making the second son like the first isn’t a good moral, so it becomes ‘accept your second child as they are rather than forcing them to be your first’s replacement’. That’s stretched in the movie to include being human in addition to his behaviors.

last_replies.com:
Hard to say because the nature of comics. You have tons of version of batmans and in which point in his history of batman you are taking into consideration.

You have the dark and lost bruce trying to save his family, you have the bruce who picks up a kid because he relates with him, you have the bruce opening up to making friends and etc..., so having an small family wouldn't work so well.

And you also have the legacy of each character to take in to account so is not like you can erase or retire all the characters you want, so you are stuck with having too much while not being able to cut out the fat. I would probably don't change the lineup of the "family" as it is but change the priority to instead of being all complete connected to bruce and Gotham they being branches around the US like the Tintas or something like that, with a bat family branch working on detroit and other in NY, so you can keep the number of people close to bruce small with having a excuse to a have fewer as possible being the "real" family.
